data_table.description: Clinic Exam Data: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1. This clinic exam questionnaire dataset consists of MD medical history and physical exam, technician interview questions, self- administered questions, ECG, blood pressure and anthropomorphic measurements.

variable.name: shareid
variable.description: Unique study participant identification number

variable.name: idtype
variable.description: Framingham Heart Study cohort identifier within a cohort
variable.comment: IDTYPE and ID taken together form a unique study participant ID number.

variable.name: g3a002
variable.description: Hospitalization (not just E.R.) ever

variable.name: g3a003
variable.description: E.R. visit ever
variable.value: Yes, 1 or more emergency room visit

variable.name: g3a004
variable.description: Day surgery

variable.name: g3a005
variable.description: Major illness with visit to doctor

variable.name: g3a006
variable.description: Check up by doctor in past 5 years

variable.name: g3a008
variable.description: Take aspirin regularly?

variable.name: g3a009
variable.description: If take aspirin regularly: Number aspirins taken

variable.name: g3a010
variable.description: If take aspirin regularly: Frequency per

variable.name: g3a011
variable.description: If take aspirin regularly: Usual dose

variable.name: g3a012
variable.description: Have you ever taken medication for hypertension/high blood pressure?

variable.name: g3a013
variable.description: If yes to G3A012, at what age did you begin

variable.description: Have you ever taken medication for high blood cholesterol?

variable.description: If yes to G3A016, at what age did you begin

variable.comment: See diabetes dataset for diabetic status.

variable.name: g3a019
variable.description: If yes to G33A016, did diabetes occur in pregnancy only?

variable.name: g3a020
variable.description: Have you ever taken medication for cardiovascular disease (for example angina/chest pain, heart failure, atrial fibrillation/heart rhythm abnormality, stroke, leg pain when walking?)

variable.name: g3a021
variable.description: If yes to G3A020, at what age did you begin

variable.name: g3a023
variable.description: How old were you when you had your first menstrual period (menses)?

variable.name: g3a024
variable.description: Have you ever taken or used oral contraceptive pills, shots, or hormone implants for birth control or medical indications (not post menopausal hormone replacement)?

variable.name: g3a025
variable.description: If OCP use, what is the name of the current or most recent oral contraceptive, shot or implant used?
variable.comment: Blank = Field not filled in Not blank = Filled in.

variable.name: g3a026
variable.description: If OCP use, strength
variable.comment: Blank = Field not filled in Not blank = Filled in.

variable.name: g3a027
variable.description: If OCP use, form

variable.name: g3a032
variable.description: If OCP use, what is the total number of years over your lifetime that you used oral contraceptives pills, shots, or hormone implants?

variable.name: g3a033
variable.description: Have you ever been pregnant?

variable.name: g3a034
variable.description: If ever been pregnant: Number of pregnancies?
variable.comment: Reported number of pregnancies of 5 or more have been combined to preserve confidentiality.

variable.name: g3a035
variable.description: If ever been pregnant: Number of live births?
variable.comment: Reported number of live births of 5 or more have been combined to preserve confidentiality.
variable.value: Never been pregnant or never had live birth

variable.name: g3a036
variable.description: If ever been pregnant: How old were you at the end of your first term pregnancy?
variable.comment: If G3A035 = 0 for no live births, then G3A036 and G3A037 may be either zero (0) or dot (.). These were left as they were originally coded.
variable.value: Never been pregnant or never had full term pregnancy
Unknown or never had full term pregnancy

variable.name: g3a037
variable.description: If ever been pregnant: How old were you at the end of your last term pregnancy?
variable.comment: This age is the same as G3A036 if only had 1 term. If G3A035 = 0 for no live births, then G3A036 and G3A037 may be either zero (0) or dot (.). These were left as they were originally coded.
variable.value: Never been pregnant or never had full term pregnancy
Unknown or never had full term pregnancy

variable.name: g3a038
variable.description: If ever been pregnant: During any of these pregnancies, were you told you had hypertension (high blood pressure)?

variable.name: g3a039
variable.description: Have you had a hysterectomy (uterus/womb removed)?

variable.name: g3a040
variable.description: If had hysterectomy: Age of hysterectomy?

variable.name: g3a043
variable.description: Have you ever had an operation to remove one or both of your ovaries?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.
variable.value: Yes, unknown number of ovaries removed
Yes, part of an ovary removed

variable.name: g3a044
variable.description: If had ovary(s) removed: Age when ovaries removed? If more than one surgery, use age at last surgery
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a045
variable.description: Have your periods stopped (for one year or more)? (Have you reached menopause?)
variable.comment: Women currently on Depo Provera for OCP use were coded as having periods not stopped for one year or more for G3A045. See G3A024 and G3A025 to see which participants are currently using Depo Provera. Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.
variable.value: Stopped but now have periods induced by hormones

variable.name: g3a049
variable.description: If periods not stopped: Normally how many days are there between your periods (start to start)?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a050
variable.description: If periods not stopped: How many periods have you had in past 12 months?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a051
variable.description: If periods stopped: Age when periods stopped
variable.comment: Instructions for coding: If periods now induced by hormones, code age when periods naturally stopped. Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a052
variable.description: If periods stopped: Was your menopause natural or the result of surgery, chemotherapy, or radiation?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a053
variable.description: If periods stopped: Have you ever taken hormone replacement therapy (estrogen/progesterone)?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a054
variable.description: If taken HRT: What age did you begin hormone replacement therapy?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a055
variable.description: If taken HRT: For how long did you take hormones (years)?
variable.comment: G3A055 and G3A056 taken together represent duration of hormone use. Use caution when calculating duration of HRT use. Some years or months are missing if left blank on the form. Use sum (of) function for example if trying to add up the year and months of HRT use. Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a056
variable.description: If taken HRT: For how long did you take hormones (months)?
variable.comment: G3A055 and G3A056 taken together represent duration of hormone use. Use caution when calculating duration of HRT use. Some years or months are missing if left blank on the form. Use sum (of) function for example if trying to add up the year and months of HRT use. Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.description: If taken HRT: Estrogen use ever?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a058
variable.description: If estrogen use ever: Name of most recent estrogen preparation
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available. Blank = Field not filled in. Not blank = Filled in.

variable.name: g3a059
variable.description: If estrogen use ever: The strength of estrogen
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available. Blank = Field not filled in. Not blank = Filled in.

variable.name: g3a060
variable.description: If estrogen use ever: Number of days per month taken
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a061
variable.description: If taken HRT: Progesterone use ever?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a062
variable.description: If progesterone use ever: Name of most recent progesterone preparation
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available. Blank = Field not filled in. Not blank = Filled in.

variable.name: g3a063
variable.description: If progesterone use ever: The strength of progesterone
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available. Blank = Field not filled in. Not blank = Filled in.

variable.name: g3a064
variable.description: If progesterone use ever: Number of days per month taken
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a065
variable.description: If periods stopped: Have you used Evista (raloxifene) or Nolvadex (tamoxifen) or other selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM)?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.description: If used SERMs: Number of months used?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.description: If periods stopped: Do you take over-the-counter alternative, herbal, or natural soy-based preparations to treat menopausal symptoms?
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available.

variable.name: g3a069
variable.description: If yes to G3A068: Specify preparation
variable.comment: Reporting inconsistencies may exist regarding menopausal status and related variables. Recommend use of the menopause reviewed dataset when available. Blank = Field not filled in. Not blank = Filled in.

variable.name: g3a070
variable.description: Have you ever smoked cigarettes regularly? (no means less than 20 packs of cigarettes or 12 oz. of tobacco in a lifetime or less than 1 cigarette a day for a year.)

variable.name: g3a073
variable.description: If ever smoked cigarettes regularly: How many cigarettes do you smoke per day now?

variable.description: If ever smoked cigarettes regularly: On the average of the entire time you smoked, how many cigarettes did you smoke per day?

variable.name: g3a075
variable.description: If ever smoked cigarettes regularly: How old were you when you first started regular cigarette smoking?

variable.name: g3a076
variable.description: If ever smoked cigarettes regularly and then stopped smoking cigarettes completely, how old were you when you stopped?

variable.name: g3a077
variable.description: If ever smoked cigarettes regularly: When you were smoking, did you ever stop smoking for > 6 months?

variable.name: g3a078
variable.description: If ever stopped for > 6 months: For how many years in total did you stop smoking cigarettes?

variable.name: g3a083
variable.description: If ever smoked pipes regularly: On the average of the entire time you smoked a pipe how much pipe tobacco did you smoke per week? (oz./week, a standard pouch of tobacco contains 1 1/2 oz.)

variable.name: g3a084
variable.description: If ever smoked pipes regularly: How old were you when you first started to smoke a pipe?

variable.name: g3a085
variable.description: If ever smoked pipes regularly and stopped smoking a pipe completely, how old were you when you stopped?

variable.name: g3a086
variable.description: If ever smoked pipes regularly: When you were smoking a pipe, did you ever stop smoking for > 6 months?

variable.name: g3a087
variable.description: If ever stopped for > 6 months: For how many years in total did you stop smoking a pipe

variable.name: g3a089

variable.description: If ever smoked cigars regularly: How old were you when you first started to smoke cigar regularly?

variable.name: g3a094
variable.description: If ever smoked cigars regularly and stopped smoking cigars completely, how old were you when you stopped?

variable.name: g3a095
variable.description: If ever smoked cigars regularly: When you were smoking cigars, did you ever stop smoking for > 6 months?

variable.name: g3a096
variable.description: If ever stopped for > 6 months: For how many years in total did you stop smoking?

variable.name: g3a097
variable.description: In your childhood, did you live with a regular cigarette smoker who smoked in your home?

variable.name: g3a098
variable.description: If yes to G3A097: Mother smoked?

variable.name: g3a099
variable.description: If yes to G3A097: Father smoked?

variable.name: g3a100
variable.description: If yes to G3A097: Others in the household smoked?

variable.name: g3a101
variable.description: If others in household smoked: How many others?

variable.name: g3a102
variable.description: As an adult, now or in the past, have you ever lived with a regular cigarette smoker who smoked in your home?

variable.description: If yes to G3A102: Spouse or partner?

variable.name: g3a104

variable.name: g3a105
variable.description: If yes to G3A102: Others in household?

variable.name: g3a106

variable.name: g3a107

variable.name: g3a110
variable.description: If yes to G3A107: Other than work?

variable.name: g3a111
variable.description: If other than work: Years of exposure

variable.name: g3a112

variable.name: g3a114
variable.description: Do you drink beer at least once a month?

variable.name: g3a115
variable.description: Beer: Number of beers (12 oz. bottle, glass, can) you drink per week over the past year
variable.comment: Participant was allowed to report alcohol consumption in either drinks per week or drinks per month. Therefore, to calculate total alcohol consumption, you must use both number of drinks per week and number of drinks per month (E.G. drinks per month = sum (of (drinks per week *4), (drinks per month))

variable.name: g3a116
variable.description: Beer: Number of beers (12 oz. bottle, glass, can) you drink per month over the past year
variable.comment: Participant was allowed to report alcohol consumption in either drinks per week or drinks per month. Therefore, to calculate total alcohol consumption, you must use both number of drinks per week and number of drinks per month (E.G. drinks per month = sum (of (drinks per week *4), (drinks per month))

variable.name: g3a494
variable.description: Using the occupation coding sheet choose the code that best describes your occupation.
variable.comment: This question was self-administered. Some of the original occupation codes have been combined into occupation groups to preserve confidentiality. The original occupation codes are available upon request. Occupation group 3 includes self-employed business owner, manager, consultant (e.g. production manager), laboratory technician, sales, marketing, insurance, realtor, writer, editor, artist, graphic designer, craftsperson, musician, mechanic, skilled labor (e.g. plumber, carpenter, painter, hairdresser), sports pro, coach and exercise instructor. Occupation group 4 includes secretary, clerk, data entry, retail, cashier, factory, assembly, restaurant, food worker, general labor (e.g. custodian, delivery, mailman, truck driver), heavy labor (e.g. construction, landscaping) and student. Occupation group 5 includes homemaker and other. Occupation group 6 includes MD, dentist, lawyer, judge, scientist, research, engineer, computer science, psychologist, social worker, mental health counselor, banker, accountant, administrative (e.g. personnel), educator, nurse, medical personnel, physical or occupational or speech therapist, police, fire, security, military, clergy (minister, priest, rabbi) and statistician.

variable.name: g3a496
variable.description: Using the occupation coding sheet choose the code that best describes the occupation you have worked in longest
variable.comment: This question was self-administered. Some of the original occupation codes have been combined into occupation groups to preserve confidentiality. The original occupation codes are available upon request. Occupation group 3 includes self-employed business owner, manager, consultant (e.g. production manager), laboratory technician, sales, marketing, insurance, realtor, writer, editor, artist, graphic designer, craftsperson, musician, mechanic, skilled labor (e.g. plumber, carpenter, painter, hairdresser), sports pro, coach and exercise instructor. Occupation group 4 includes secretary, clerk, data entry, retail, cashier, factory, assembly, restaurant, food worker, general labor (e.g. custodian, delivery, mailman, truck driver), heavy labor (e.g. construction, landscaping) and student. Occupation group 5 includes homemaker, retired and other. Occupation group 6 includes MD, dentist, lawyer, judge, scientist, research, engineer, computer science, psychologist, social worker, mental health counselor, banker, accountant, administrative (e.g. personnel), educator, nurse, medical personnel, physical or occupational or speech therapist, police, fire, security, military, clergy (minister, priest, rabbi) and statistician.
